author: Staff Reporter
text:
Considering a dispute in the ownership of a private property (VGP Thidal) where the Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) has planned to conduct its State-level meeting on February 14, the Madras High Court on Wednesday restrained the party from proceeding with construction on the site till Friday.

The Division Bench of Justices Sathish K. Agnihotri and M. Venugopal passed the interim order on an appeal moved by the Director General of Police assailing the order of a single judge dated January 29 permitting the meeting which was denied permission by the Kancheepuram district administration.

When the appeal came up for hearing, the government authorities submitted that the 95.74 acres of land where the PMK has sought permission to conduct the meeting has been declared scruples under the Tamil Nadu Land Reforms (Fixation of Ceiling on Land) Act, 1961 and was duly notified in the government gazette on September 26, 1979. Thereafter, a dispute rose over the ownership of the property which is still pending before the High Court.
title: HC restrains PMK from holding its State-level meet
